intro: Eurybia shreberi, commonly known as the Shreber's goldenrod, is a herbaceous perennial native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small yellow daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, producing abundant yellow blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eurybia shreberi thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
